argument.description: The set of characters that will be removed from both the left-hand and right-hand side of string. If this parameter is omitted, the btrim function will remove space characters from both sides of string.

description: The PostgreSQL btrim function removes all specified characters from both the beginning and the end of a string.
sample:
postgres=# SELECT btrim('  techonthenet.com  ', ' ');
      btrim
--------------------
 'techonthenet.com'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT btrim('   techonthenet.com   ');
      btrim
--------------------
 'techonthenet.com'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT btrim('123Tech123', '123');
 btrim
--------
 'Tech'
(1 row)
